method_summary: U-GCN is designed to address the limitations of traditional Graph Convolutional Networks (GCNs) by introducing a universal propagation mechanism that operates independently of network structural assumptions. It incorporates a multi-type convolution mechanism that simultaneously extracts information from 1-hop, 2-hop, and k-nearest neighbor (kNN) networks. The method further employs a discriminative aggregation technique to fuse the information extracted from these various network types, aiming to identify node embeddings that are optimal for the given learning objectives.
experiment_summary: Extensive experiments demonstrate that U-GCN outperforms existing state-of-the-art methods across various datasets characterized by differing levels of homophily and heterophily. Evaluation shows that its novel approach of using multiple types of propagation mechanisms—considering 1-hop, 2-hop, and kNN nodes—leads to improved accuracy in node classification tasks. The experimental results validate the effectiveness of U-GCN in adapting to various network properties.
